recipes.title: Creamy Garlic Pasta
recipes.summary: A rich and comforting pasta dish with garlic and cream.

steps.step: Fill a large pot with water, add a generous pinch of salt, and bring it to a rolling boil over high heat.
Once boiling, add the fettuccine pasta and cook for approximately 8-10 minutes, or until it reaches 'al dente' texture.
While the pasta is cooking, place a large skillet over medium heat and melt the butter until it starts to foam slightly.
Add the finely minced garlic to the butter and sauté for about 1 minute, stirring constantly to ensure it doesn't burn but becomes fragrant.
Gradually pour in the heavy cream and whisk gently. Bring the mixture to a low simmer and let it reduce for 3-5 minutes until it starts to thicken.
Lower the heat and stir in the grated parmesan cheese. Continue stirring until the cheese is completely melted and the sauce is smooth and velvety.
Drain the pasta, reserving a small splash of the pasta water. Toss the pasta directly into the sauce skillet, adding the reserved water if the sauce is too thick.
Season with salt and freshly cracked black pepper. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve immediately while steaming hot.

recipes.title: Spicy Chicken Tacos
recipes.summary: Quick and flavorful tacos with a spicy kick.

steps.step: Start by preparing the chicken breast. Trim any excess fat and cut the chicken into uniform, bite-sized cubes for even cooking.
In a large mixing bowl, toss the chicken cubes with the taco seasoning until every piece is thoroughly coated.
Heat a splash of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the chicken in a single layer.
Sear the chicken for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it is golden brown on the outside and cooked through to the center.
While the chicken cooks, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and place the corn taco shells on a baking sheet for 3-5 minutes to crisp them up.
Finely shred the lettuce, dice the tomatoes, and thinly slice the red onion to prepare your fresh toppings.
Fill each warmed taco shell with a generous portion of the spicy seared chicken.
Top with the lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. Finish with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro and serve with lime wedges for a fresh squeeze of citrus.

recipes.title: Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.summary: A fast and healthy stir fry packed with fresh vegetables.

steps.step: Thoroughly wash and dry all the vegetables. Chop the broccoli into small florets, slice the peppers into strips, and cut the carrots into thin coins.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce with a teaspoon of honey or brown sugar (optional) to create a simple stir-fry sauce.
Place a large wok or a heavy-bottomed skillet over high heat and add the sesame oil. Allow it to heat until it just starts to shimmer.
Add the freshly grated ginger and minced garlic to the oil. Stir-fry rapidly for 30 seconds, being careful not to let them brown or burn.
Toss in the broccoli and carrots first, as they take the longest to cook. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until they start to soften.
Add the bell peppers and snap peas to the wok. Continue to stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes until all vegetables are bright and tender-crisp.
Pour the soy sauce mixture over the vegetables. Toss everything together continuously for 1 minute to ensure even coating and a glossy finish.
Remove from heat immediately. Serve the vibrant vegetables over a bed of steamed jasmine rice or brown rice, and garnish with sesame seeds if desired.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
recipes.summary: A refreshing bowl with quinoa, veggies, and herbs.

steps.step: Rinse the quinoa under cold water in a fine-mesh sieve until the water runs clear to remove any natural bitter coating.
Combine the rinsed quinoa with 2 cups of water or vegetable broth in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 15 minutes until the liquid is fully absorbed and the quinoa is fluffy.
Remove the quinoa from heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes. Then, fluff it with a fork and let it cool slightly.
While the quinoa cooks, dice the cucumber, halve the cherry tomatoes, and finely slice the red onion. Drain and rinse the canned chickpeas.
In a small jar or bowl, whisk together the extra virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, salt, pepper, and a pinch of dried oregano.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the fluffed quinoa, chopped vegetables, chickpeas, and kalamata olives.
Pour the lemon-olive oil dressing over the bowl and toss thoroughly to combine. Serve at room temperature or chill in the fridge for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

recipes.title: Lemon Butter Salmon
recipes.summary: Tender salmon baked with lemon and butter.

steps.step: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper for easy cleanup.
Pat the salmon fillets dry with paper towels. This helps the seasoning stick and ensures a better texture after baking.
Melt the butter in a small microwave-safe bowl. Stir in the minced garlic and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Place the salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet. Brush the garlic-butter mixture generously over the top and sides of each fillet.
Thinly slice the lemon and place 2-3 slices directly on top of each salmon piece. Arrange any remaining lemon slices around them on the tray.
Sprinkle the fresh chopped dill over the salmon. The herb will infuse the fish with a fresh aroma as it bakes.
Bake in the center of the oven for 12-15 minutes. The exact time will depend on the thickness of your fillets; they are done when the fish flakes easily with a fork.
For a slightly crispy top, you can turn on the broiler for the last 1-2 minutes. Serve immediately with your choice of roasted vegetables or a light salad.

recipes.title: Thai Green Curry
recipes.summary: A fragrant Thai curry made with coconut milk and fresh herbs.

steps.step: Open the can of coconut milk and scoop out the thick, solid white cream from the top into a large pot or deep skillet over medium heat.
Stir the coconut cream for a couple of minutes until it starts to bubble and release its oil.
Add the green curry paste to the pot. Stir-fry the paste in the coconut cream for 2-3 minutes until it becomes intensely fragrant.
Add the bite-sized pieces of chicken thighs to the pot. Stir to coat the chicken in the paste and cook until the outside is no longer pink.
Pour in the remaining liquid coconut milk from the can. Bring the mixture to a gentle boil, then immediately reduce the heat to a simmer.
Stir in the bamboo shoots, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Let the curry simmer uncovered for 15-20 minutes to thicken slightly and cook the chicken through.
Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning—add more fish sauce for saltiness or sugar for sweetness if needed.
Turn off the heat and stir in the fresh Thai basil leaves. Serve the aromatic curry in deep bowls alongside steamed jasmine rice.

recipes.title: Classic French Onion Soup
recipes.summary: A deep, savory soup topped with toasted bread and melted cheese.

steps.step: Peel the onions and slice them into very thin, uniform half-moons. This ensures they cook and caramelize at the same rate.
In a heavy-bottomed stockpot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Add the onions and toss to coat them in the butter.
Cook the onions slowly for 30-45 minutes. Stir every 5 minutes, scraping the bottom of the pot, until the onions are soft and a deep, rich mahogany brown.
Pour in the beef broth and add the dried thyme and bay leaf. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes to develop the flavor.
While the soup simmers, slice the baguette into 1-inch thick rounds. Toast them in the oven or a toaster until they are golden and quite firm.
Taste the soup and season with salt and pepper. Remove the bay leaf. Ladle the hot soup into four oven-safe ceramic bowls.
Place two slices of toasted bread on top of each bowl, then cover generously with a mound of shredded Gruyere cheese.
Place the bowls on a baking sheet and put them under the broiler for 2-4 minutes until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and has brown spots. Serve immediately with care.

recipes.title: Korean Beef Bulgogi
recipes.summary: Sweet and savory marinated beef cooked quickly over high heat.

steps.step: For the best texture, place the flank steak in the freezer for about 20 minutes to firm it up before slicing. This makes it much easier to get thin cuts.
Slice the steak against the grain into very thin, wide strips. The thinner the slices, the more tender and flavorful the final dish will be.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, and minced garlic until the sugar has mostly dissolved.
Place the sliced beef into a large resealable bag or bowl and pour the marinade over it. Massage the meat to ensure it's well-coated and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat a large cast-iron skillet or wok over high heat until it is smoking slightly. Add a tablespoon of oil and swirl to coat.
Add the beef in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding the pan. Sear for 1-2 minutes per side until charred and caramelized.
Once all the beef is cooked, return it all to the pan for a final 30-second toss to heat through.
Transfer to a serving plate and garnish heavily with sliced green onions and toasted sesame seeds. Serve with steamed rice and lettuce leaves for wrapping.

recipes.title: Greek Chicken Gyros
recipes.summary: Juicy marinated chicken wrapped in warm pita with homemade tzatziki.

steps.step: Cut the chicken breast into long, thin strips. Place them in a bowl and mix with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the juice of half a lemon, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Let the chicken marinate at room temperature for 15-20 minutes while you prepare the sauce.
To make the tzatziki, grate the cucumber and use a clean kitchen towel to squeeze out as much moisture as possible. This is key to a thick sauce.
Mix the squeezed cucumber with Greek yogurt, minced garlic, a splash of olive oil, and the remaining lemon juice.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken strips and cook for 6-8 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are golden and fully cooked.
While the chicken is cooking, lightly toast the pita bread rounds in a dry pan or directly over a low flame until soft and pliable.
Spread a generous dollop of tzatziki down the center of each warm pita. Add the cooked chicken strips.
Top with thinly sliced red onions, fresh tomatoes, and maybe a few fries if you want it traditional. Roll the pita tightly and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Spanish Paella
recipes.summary: A vibrant Spanish rice dish with saffron, seafood, and chorizo.

steps.step: In a medium pot, bring the chicken broth to a simmer. Add the saffron threads and keep the broth warm on the lowest heat setting.
Place a wide, shallow paella pan or a large skillet over medium heat. Add a little olive oil and sauté the sliced chorizo until the fat renders and it's slightly crisp.
Add the arborio rice to the pan with the chorizo. Stir for 1-2 minutes until the rice is translucent around the edges and well-coated in the flavorful oil.
Carefully pour the warm saffron-infused broth over the rice. Shake the pan to distribute the rice evenly, then bring to a gentle boil.
Reduce the heat to medium-low. Important: From this point on, do not stir the rice! Stirring will make it creamy like risotto, but paella should be dry and distinct.
After about 15 minutes of simmering, once the rice has absorbed most of the liquid, arrange the shrimp and cleaned mussels on top of the rice.
Sprinkle the peas over the top and continue cooking for 10 more minutes until the seafood is cooked and the mussels have opened. (Discard any that stay closed).

In the final minutes, you might hear a slight crackling sound—this is the 'socarrat' (the delicious toasted rice crust) forming on the bottom. Remove from heat, cover with a towel for 5 minutes, and serve with lemon.

recipes.title: Margherita Pizza
recipes.summary: A classic Italian pizza with simple, high-quality ingredients.

steps.step: Place a pizza stone or a large inverted baking sheet in your oven and preheat it to its maximum temperature (usually 500°F/260°C) for at least 30 minutes.
Prepare the sauce by simply crushing the San Marzano tomatoes by hand or with a fork in a bowl. Add a pinch of salt—true Margherita sauce is very simple.
On a lightly floured surface, gently stretch the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle. Try to keep the edges slightly thicker to form a nice crust.
Transfer the dough to a piece of parchment paper or a pizza peel dusted with cornmeal.
Spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border for the crust. Tear the fresh mozzarella into small chunks and distribute them evenly.
Slide the pizza onto the hot stone or baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes until the crust is puffed and charred in spots, and the cheese is bubbling.
Remove the pizza from the oven. Immediately scatter fresh whole basil leaves over the top—the residual heat will release their aroma without wilting them too much.
Finish with a generous drizzle of high-quality extra virgin olive oil. Slice and serve immediately while the crust is at its crispest.

recipes.title: Tomato Basil Penne
recipes.summary: A simple and fresh pasta dish perfect for a quick weekday meal.

steps.step: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil and add a healthy amount of salt.
Add the penne pasta and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until just tender. Reserving half a cup of pasta water before draining.
While the pasta is boiling, wash and halve the cherry tomatoes. Finely mince the garlic cloves.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute until it becomes aromatic but not browned.
Add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet with a pinch of salt. Sauté for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes soften and start to burst.
Once the tomatoes have released their juices to form a light sauce, toss in the drained penne pasta.
Add the reserved pasta water if needed to loosen the sauce. Stir everything together over the heat for 1 minute to marry the flavors.
Remove from heat and stir in a generous amount of freshly torn basil leaves. Serve with an extra drizzle of olive oil on top.

recipes.title: Butter Chicken
recipes.summary: Creamy and rich Indian chicken curry in a spiced tomato sauce.

steps.step: Cut the chicken into uniform 1-inch cubes. In a bowl, toss the chicken with the ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, and a pinch of salt. Let it marinate for 20 minutes.
Heat a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add the chicken in batches and brown them on all sides.
Once the chicken is browned, remove it from the pot and set it aside. Add the remaining butter to the same pot.
Stir in the tomato puree and garam masala. Cook the sauce for 5-8 minutes, stirring frequently, until it starts to darken and thicken.
Return the chicken and any accumulated juices to the pot. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10-12 minutes until the chicken is tender.
Pour in the heavy cream and stir gently until the sauce turns into a beautiful vibrant orange color and is velvety smooth.
Let it simmer for another 2 minutes, being careful not to let it boil vigorously once the cream is added.
Garnish with a little extra cream or fresh cilantro. Serve hot with buttery naan bread or fragrant basmati rice.

recipes.title: Sushi Bowl
recipes.summary: A deconstructed sushi experience with fresh fish, rice, and vegetables.

steps.step: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water several times until the water is clear. Cook the rice in a rice cooker or on the stovetop according to package directions.
While the rice is still hot, gently fold in a mixture of rice vinegar, a teaspoon of sugar, and a pinch of salt. Let it cool to room temperature.
Ensure your salmon is sushi-grade. Use a sharp knife to cut it into small, clean half-inch cubes.
Prepare the vegetables: thinly slice the cucumber into rounds, and cut the avocado into long, thin slices.
Divide the seasoned sushi rice into two large serving bowls, smoothing the surface slightly.
Arrange the salmon cubes, cucumber rounds, and avocado slices in separate sections on top of the rice for a beautiful presentation.
Add a small mound of pickled ginger and a dollop of wasabi (optional) to the side of each bowl.
Drizzle with soy sauce and sprinkle with sesame seeds or shredded nori before serving.

recipes.title: Beef Ramen
recipes.summary: Savory beef broth with noodles, tender beef, and a soft-boiled egg.

steps.step: In a large pot, combine the beef broth, soy sauce, a slice of ginger, and a clove of smashed garlic. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 10 minutes.
While the broth simmers, bring a small separate pot of water to a boil. Carefully lower in two eggs and boil for exactly 6 minutes and 30 seconds for a perfect jammy yolk.
Immediately transfer the eggs to an ice bath to stop the cooking. Once cool, peel them carefully and set aside.
Add the ramen noodles to the simmering broth pot and cook for 2-3 minutes until they are just tender.
In the last minute of noodle cooking, add the halved bok choy to the broth to blanch it until it's bright green and slightly softened.
Heat a small skillet over high heat with a drop of oil. Sear the thinly sliced beef for just 30 seconds per side until browned but still tender.
Ladle the noodles and a generous amount of broth into two deep bowls. Arrange the bok choy and seared beef on top.
Slice the soft-boiled eggs in half and place one in each bowl. Garnish with sliced green onions and a drizzle of chili oil if you like it spicy.
